unit_learning_outcomes.description: Identify, evaluate and deploy the grammatical structures of Russian at intermediate level.
Develop intermediate level skills in reading, writing, listening and speaking in the Russian language.
Demonstrate a refined awareness of language and language use, in both Russian and in English.
Identify, describe and evaluate many aspects of Russian-speaking cultures and societies.
Apply relevant language conventions to create meaningful intercultural encounters.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on daily review of grammar and vocabulary. Students should be familiar with and feel comfortable with each week’s content before starting a new week. Class preparation time also includes time to study, revise seminar content and prepare for the quizzes and tests

enrolment_rules.description: RSN155 or RUSS1020 or RSN160 or RUSS1030

assessments.description: The purpose of the test is to check students’ knowledge of all aspects of grammar and vocabulary that they learn throughout the session. This will be held as a part of regular class time.
Students have to demonstrate their knowledge and engagement with material explained during the session. This will be a part of regular seminar time and preparation time.

Students have to demonstrate their knowledge and engagement with material explained during the session. Students are expected to spend time on daily review of grammar and vocabulary. Students should be familiar with and feel comfortable with each week’s content before starting a new week. Class preparation time also includes time to study, revise seminar content and prepare for the quizzes and tests.

For the oral test, students have to prepare a short talk on a topic of their choice. Students will be assessed on their presentation, as well as their ability to answer follow-up questions. This will be held as a part of regular seminar time and online students will do this activity via Zoom.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Fully online/virtual
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances, North Ryde

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This is an intermediate Russian unit, which is designed for students with the knowledge of Russian that is equivalent to one year of studying the language at university level. The unit seeks to further develop students' skills in reading, writing, comprehension and speaking in Russian, as well as to expand students' knowledge of contemporary Russian culture. Students are encouraged to use their language skills to communicate in a variety of situations and contexts.
data.title: I Russian Studies 3
